p: Innate immune antagonism is a common function of many viral non-structural proteins ( Randall and Goodbourn, 2008), including NSs proteins from bunyaviruses ( Walter and Barr, 2011). Non-structural viral proteins have been previously structurally characterized, such as the NS1 protein of influenza virus ( Bornholdt and Prasad, 2008; Liu et al., 1997), VP35 of Ebola virus ( Leung et al., 2009) or NS5A from hepatitis C virus ( Feuerstein et al., 2012; Tellinghuisen et al., 2005). These studies have contributed to understanding both viral pathology and the innate immune system.
